element.name: Laserllama’s Alternate Artificer
element.description: A Streamlined and Satisfying take on the Masters of Arcane Invention

description.p: A graying gnome was hunched over his workbench, carefully adjusting the clockwork mechanism that would power his creation. Before him laid an automaton of intricate iron gears within a shell of custom plate armor, built to resemble a large gnome. The pint-sized inventor affixed his signature, a mithril mustache, to the face plate. As he did, a jolt of electric- -blue arcane energy flashed from the automaton. With a sharp motion, the Finnblewright Mark II sat upright and awaited the first command of its creator.

The small goblin delicately made his way down the tunnel that he had set with deadly traps. This was the third time this year his clan had moved to avoid being raided by adventuring parties, and the inventive goblin was determined to protect the newest cave that was their home. He was confident that this time his traps would stop the adventurers that always seemed to find their way to his home.

A young human woman, wearing a worn leather apron over her fine clothes, flexed the steel gauntlet she had just finished enchanting. As she closed her fist the gauntlet let forth a blinding arc of lavender lightning, destroying the table on the opposite side of the room. As the dust settled, she affixed the gauntlet to her now complete suit of arcane armor. When she reveled this to her father, the latest in a long line of strange experiments, he would have no choice but to finally show her his approval.
All of these characters described above are artificers, masters of imbuing arcane magic into wondrous inventions.

Relentless in their pursuit of innovation, every artificer is defined by an insatiable curiosity and willingness to push the limits of arcane invention, even at great personal risk to themselves. An artificer defines themselves by the fruits of their work, and they see mastering the basics of their chosen craft as the first step toward true greatness.

Deep down, the goal of every artificer is the discovery of a new groundbreaking invention, magical or otherwise. Some artificers are engineers, students of science and warfare, who bring their considerable intellect to bear to construct deadly weapons augmented with magic. Others see themselves as arcane artists, combining the rigid arcane formulas of wizardry with the artisanal touch of their own tools.

Almost every artificer has a least one rival, someone who they seek to outdo at every turn. These rivalries are the sole motivation of some artificers, and to them, outdoing their rival is more valuable then any fame or riches they could gain from their discoveries. Many are willing to risk everything to arrive the site of a new discovery before their rival.

By the same token, artificers with similar philosophies and aims often band together in loose artisan’s guilds. They share insights and discoveries, hoping to keep ahead of rival guilds by pooling resources and working as a team. However, even when working together, most artificers are protective of any insights they think could lead to a groundbreaking discovery.

When creating an artificer, think about their background and drive for adventure. Who is their rival and what event started their feud? What is your artificer’s relationship with the artisan who taught them the basics of their craft? Are they part of a guild? What role do artificers play in the campaign world? Do artificer guilds exist in all the major cities, or are you the first person to pursue the path of arcane invention?

You can make an artificer quickly by using these suggestions. First, make Intelligence your highest ability score, followed by Dexterity. Second, choose the artisan background. Third, choose the Enhanced Defense and Repeating Shot Infusions.

div.p: If your group uses the rule on multiclassing in the Player’s Handbook, here’s what you need to know if you choose the artificer as one of your classes.
Ability Score Minimum. As a multiclass character, you must have a 13 in Intelligence to take a level in this class, or to take a level in another class if you are already a artificer.
Proficiencies Gained. If artificer isn’t your initial class, you gain proficiency with light armor, medium armor, shields, tinker’s tools, and one set of artisan’s tools of your choice.

description.p: As an artificer, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Dice: 1d8 per artificer level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per artificer level after 1st
Armor: Light armor, medium armor, shields
Weapons: Simple weapons, hand crossbows, (firearms)
Tools: Thieves’ tools, tinker’s tools, one type of artisan’s tools.
Saving Throws: Constitution, Intelligence
Skills: Choose two from Arcana, History, Insight, Investigation, Medicine, Nature, Perception, Sleight of Hand.

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: a simple weapon and a set of artisan’s tools of your choice
(a) studded leather or (b) scale mail
A light crossbow and 20 bolts
Tinker’s tools and a dungeoneer’s pack

setters.set: A Streamlined and Satisfying take on the Masters of Arcane Invention
If artificer isn’t your initial class, you gain proficiency with light armor, medium armor, shields, tinker’s tools, and one set of artisan’s tools of your choice.

description.p: At 1st level, choose one of the following Artificer Specialties: Alchemist, Archivist, Armorer, Battle Smith, or Wandslinger, each of which is detailed at the end of this class description. Your Artificer Specialty grants features at 1st level, and again when you reach 3rd, 5th, 9th, and 15th level in this class.
Each Specialty has a list of spells that you gain at the artificer levels noted in its description. These count as artificer spells for you, but they don’t count against your total Spells Known.

You have learned to infuse objects with your signature brand of magic. At 1st level, you learn two Infusions of your choice from the list at the end of this class. As you gain levels in this class, you learn additional Infusions, as shown in the Infusions Known column of the Artificer table.

At the end of a long rest, if you have access to your tinker’s tools, or a set of artisan’s tools that you are proficient with, you can replace one of your Infusions Known with another Infusion of your choice that you meet the prerequisites for.

At the end of a long rest, you can use your tinker’s tools, or a set of artisan’s tools that you are proficient with, to touch a nonmagical object, imbuing it with one Infusion you know. If the Infusion requires attunement, you can attune the instant you infuse the item, or you can forgo attunement so another creature can attune to it. If you decide to attune to the item later, you must follow the normal attunement process.

The Infusion remains in an item indefinitely. If you die, the Infusion vanishes after a number of days have passed equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1 day). Infusions vanish immediately if you give up your knowledge of one to learn another, or imbue the Infusion into another object.

You can infuse more than one nonmagical object at the end of each long rest, up to one for each Infusion you know. You must touch each of the objects, and each Infusion can be in only one object at a time, but, no object can bear more than one Infusion at a time. If you transfer an Infusion to a new object, the previous instance of that Infusion immediately ends, and then the Infusion applies to the new object.

sheet.description: At the end of a long rest, you can use your tinker’s tools, or a set of artisan’s tools that you are proficient with, to touch a nonmagical object, imbuing it with one Infusion you know. You can infuse more than one nonmagical object at the end of each long rest, up to {{infusions:count}}. At the end of a long rest, if you have access to your tinker’s tools, or a set of artisan’s tools that you are proficient with, you can replace one of your Infusions Known with another Infusion of your choice that you meet the prerequisites for.

description.p: Using your signature tools and your own special brand of arcane magic, you can produce spell effects from strange and wondrous objects. See chapter 11 of the Player’s Handbook for the general rules of spellcasting and the artificer spell list included with this class for your list of spells.

The Artificer table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st-level and higher. To cast a spell, you must expend a slot equal to the spell’s level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell magic missile and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast magic missile using either spell slot.

You know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the artificer spell list. The Spells Known column of the Artificer table shows when you learn more artificer spells of your choice. Each spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, when you reach 5th level in this class, you can learn one new artificer spell of either 1st or 2nd-level.
When you gain a level, you can choose one artificer spell you know and replace it with another spell from the artificer spell list that is of a level for which you have spell slots.

Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for artificer spells, as your understanding of the theory behind magic to produce spells. You use Intelligence whenever an artificer spell refers to your spellcasting ability, and you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for an artificer spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.
Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier
You must use either your tinker’s tools, a set of artisan’s tools with which you are proficient, or an item bearing one of your Infusions as spellcasting focus for your artificer spells.

While you have access to your tinker’s tools or a set of artisan’s tools with which you are proficient, you know the mending cantrip and the identify spell, but they don’t count against your total number of Spells Known. You can cast identify normally by expending a spell slot, or as a ritual.

sheet.description: You must use either your tinker’s tools, a set of artisan’s tools with which you are proficient, or an item bearing one of your Infusions as spellcasting focus for your artificer spells. You can cast identify normally by expending a spell slot, or as a ritual.

description.p: When you reach 4th level, 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Starting at 6th level, you can alter and adjust your Infusions in order to better meet the challenges at hand. At the end of a short rest, so long as you have access to your tinker’s tools, or a set of artisan’s tools with which you are proficient, you can replace one of your Infusions Known with another Infusion of your choice, immediately imbuing it into an object you touch.
If the Infusion requires attunement, it follows the normal rules for attuning to an Infused item. If the Infused item has charges, it has zero charges until you complete a long rest.
Once you use this ability you must complete a long rest before you can use it again.

sheet.description: At the end of a short rest, so long as you have access to your tinker’s tools, or a set of artisan’s tools with which you are proficient, you can replace one of your Infusions Known with another Infusion of your choice, immediately imbuing it into an object you touch.

description.p: There are few who can match an artificer’s raw skill with their tools. Beginning at 6th level, whenever you make an ability check that uses a tool with which you are proficient, you can add double your proficiency bonus to your roll.

sheet.description: Whenever you make an ability check that uses a tool with which you are proficient, you can add double your proficiency bonus to your roll.

description.p: Beginning at 7th level, your analytical mind can offer insights and suggestions at a moments notice. As a reaction, when you, or another creature you can see within 30 feet, makes an ability check or a saving throw, you can add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to the result of the roll.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When you, or another creature you can see within 30 feet, makes an ability check or a saving throw, you can add {{int-mod:min-one}} to the result of the roll.

description.p: You have gained a deep understanding of the inner workings and creation of magic items. Beginning at 10th level, you can attune to up to four magic items at once, and for you, crafting a magic item with a rarity of Common or Uncommon takes a quarter of the normal time and costs half the normal gold.
The number of magic items you can attune to at one time increases at 14th level (5 items) and 18th level (6 items).

sheet.description: Crafting a magic item with a rarity of Common or Uncommon takes a quarter of the normal time and costs half the normal gold.

description.p: Starting at 11th level, you master the storing of magic within the mundane. At the end of each long rest, you can touch one weapon or item and imbue it with an artificer spell of 1st or 2nd-level of your choice, that has a casting time of 1 action.
While holding the item, any creature can use an action to cast the imbued spell using your spellcasting ability modifier. If it requires concentration, they must concentrate on it.
The spell stays imbued in the object until it has been used a number of times equal to twice your Intelligence modifier (minimum of twice) or until you use this feature again.

sheet.description: At the end of each long rest, you can touch one weapon or item and imbue it with an artificer spell of 1st or 2nd-level of your choice, that has a casting time of 1 action. While holding the item, any creature can use an action to cast the imbued spell using your spellcasting ability modifier. If it requires concentration, they must concentrate on it. The spell stays imbued in the object until it has been used {{wondrous-item:uses}} times or until you use this feature again.

description.p: Beginning at 14th level, your expert understanding of magic items allows you to attune to any magic item regardless of any alignment, class, race, spell, or level requirements.

sheet.description: You can to attune to any magic item regardless of any alignment, class, race, spell, or level requirements.

description.p: You imbue a spark of your own essence in the magic items you bear. At 20th level, you gain a +1 bonus to all saving throws for each magic item you are attuned to. In addition, if you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed out-right, you can choose to to end your attunement to one magic item or Infusion, causing you to drop to 1 hit point instead of 0.

sheet.description: You gain a +{{attunement:current}} bonus to all saving throws. In addition, if you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed out-right, you can choose to to end your attunement to one magic item or Infusion, causing you to drop to 1 hit point instead of 0.

description.p: Alchemy is a delicate art, tip the ratio of ingredients too far out of line and the effects could be disastrous. Those that study the magic of arcane potions and brews are known as Alchemists. They are experts at combining exotic reagents to produce a variety of materials and effects. From healing droughts that can mend a wound in moments, to sticky goo that explodes when it comes in contact with open flame. With careful preparation, and a bit of luck, Alchemists are masters of both giving life and leeching it away.

At the end of each long rest, you can use your alchemist’s supplies to prepare one copy of each Elixir you know, without expending spell slots. These Elixirs are contained in Tiny glass vials, always produce the spell effects at their lowest level, and become inert at the end of your next long rest.

As an action, a creature can drink an Elixir, administer an Elixir to a willing creature, or throw an Elixir at a point within 30 feet. If thrown, the Elixir takes effect at the point of impact. If an Elixir produces an effect that requires concentration, the creature that consumes the Elixir must concentrate on the effect as if they were concentrating on a spell. Elixirs use your artificer spell save DC.

For example, if you chose the Create Minor Elixir infusion and selected cure wounds and grease, then at the end of each long rest you prepare one cure wounds Elixir, and one grease Elixir. You can then use these Elixirs at some point during the adventuring day without expending a spell slot.

As an action, you can create an additional copy of an Elixir you know by expending the spell slot required in the Elixir’s infusion description. Elixirs can be used as part of the same action you expended the spell slot to create them.

When you adopt the alchemist specialty at 1st-level, you gain proficiency with alchemist’s supplies. If you are already proficient with alchemist’s supplies, you gain proficiency with another set of artisan’s tools of your choice.

Starting at 1st-level, you learn to create Elixirs that mimic the effects of spells. Your total number of Infusions Known increases by one, but this additional infusion must be an Elixir. You gain a second bonus infusion at 9th-level, and a third at 15th-level, both of which must be Elixirs. See the end of this subclass for additional Elixir rules and effects.

Beginning at 3rd-level, your alchemical experiments have yielded you a tiny homunculus servant. You determine the homunculus’ appearance, it is friendly to you and your companions, and it obeys your commands. See this creature’s game statistics in the Homunculus Servant stat block, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places.

In combat, the homunculus shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the Dodge action, unless you use a bonus action to command it to take another action, or an action from its stat block. If you are incapacitated, the homunculus can take any action of its choice. If you die, the homunculus turns to ash.
If it has died within the last hour, you can use an action to revive it by touching it and expending a spell slot of 1st-level or higher. It returns to life with its maximum hit points.
At the end of a long rest, you can create a new homunculus by using your alchemist’s supplies. If you already have a homunculus from this feature, the first one turns to ash.

sheet.description: In combat, the homunculus shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the Dodge action, unless you use a bonus action to command it to take another action, or an action from its stat block.

description.p: Starting at 5th-level, when one of your Elixirs or spells deals acid, fire, nercrotic, or poison damage, or restores hit points to a creature, you gain a bonus to the damage, or healing roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).

sheet.description: When one of your Elixirs or spells deals acid, fire, nercrotic, or poison damage, or restores hit points to a creature, you gain a +{{int-mod:min-one}} bonus to the damage, or healing roll.

description.p: Beginning at 9th-level, whenever a creature drinks one of your Elixirs, they gain temporary hit points equal to 2d6 + your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1 temporary hit point).

sheet.description: Whenever a creature drinks one of your Elixirs, they gain 2d6 + {{int-mod:min-one}} temporary hit points.

description.p: You have become a master among alchemist artificers. Upon reaching 15th-level, you are resistant to acid and poison damage, and you are immune to the poisoned condition.
Prerequisite: 1st-level alchemist
Each time you select this infusion, choose two Elixir effects to learn from the table below. To produce additional minor Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher.

sheet.description: To produce additional minor Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher.

description.p: Prerequisite: 1st-level alchemist
Each time you select this infusion, choose two Elixir effects to learn from the table below. To produce additional minor Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher.
Prerequisite: 1st-level alchemist
Each time you select this infusion, choose two Elixir effects to learn from the table below. To produce additional minor Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher.
Prerequisite: 1st-level alchemist
Each time you select this infusion, choose two Elixir effects to learn from the table below. To produce additional minor Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher.
Prerequisite: 1st-level alchemist
Each time you select this infusion, choose two Elixir effects to learn from the table below. To produce additional minor Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher.
Prerequisite: 5th-level alchemist
Each time you select this infusion, choose one Elixir effect to learn from the table below. To produce additional greater Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 2nd-level or higher.

sheet.description: To produce greater Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 2nd-level or higher.

description.p: Prerequisite: 5th-level alchemist
Each time you select this infusion, choose one Elixir effect to learn from the table below. To produce additional greater Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 2nd-level or higher.
Prerequisite: 5th-level alchemist
Each time you select this infusion, choose one Elixir effect to learn from the table below. To produce additional greater Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 2nd-level or higher.
Prerequisite: 5th-level alchemist
Each time you select this infusion, choose one Elixir effect to learn from the table below. To produce additional greater Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 2nd-level or higher.
Prerequisite: 5th-level alchemist
Each time you select this infusion, choose one Elixir effect to learn from the table below. To produce additional greater Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 2nd-level or higher.
Prerequisite: 9th-level alchemist
Each time you select this infusion, choose one Elixir effect to learn from the table below. To produce more advanced Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 3rd-level or higher.

sheet.description: To produce more advanced Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 3rd-level or higher.

description.p: Prerequisite: 9th-level alchemist
Each time you select this infusion, choose one Elixir effect to learn from the table below. To produce more advanced Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 3rd-level or higher.
Prerequisite: 9th-level alchemist
Each time you select this infusion, choose one Elixir effect to learn from the table below. To produce more advanced Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 3rd-level or higher.
Prerequisite: 9th-level alchemist
Each time you select this infusion, choose one Elixir effect to learn from the table below. To produce more advanced Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 3rd-level or higher.
Prerequisite: 9th-level alchemist
Each time you select this infusion, choose one Elixir effect to learn from the table below. To produce more advanced Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 3rd-level or higher.
Prerequisite: 15th-level alchemist
Each time you select this infusion, choose one Elixir effect to learn from the table below. To produce more masterwork Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 4th-level or higher.
Prerequisite: 15th-level alchemist
Each time you select this infusion, choose one Elixir effect to learn from the table below. To produce more masterwork Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 4th-level or higher.
Prerequisite: 15th-level alchemist
Each time you select this infusion, choose one Elixir effect to learn from the table below. To produce more masterwork Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 4th-level or higher.
Prerequisite: 15th-level alchemist
Each time you select this infusion, choose one Elixir effect to learn from the table below. To produce more masterwork Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 4th-level or higher.
Prerequisite: 15th-level alchemist
Each time you select this infusion, choose one Elixir effect to learn from the table below. To produce more masterwork Elixirs, you must expend a spell slot of 4th-level or higher.

Of all the specialties that an artificer can pursue, that of the armorer is the most defensively minded. Focused on becoming a bastion of metal and magic, armorers modify a set of armor to function as a second skin. They focus the magic of their artifice through their armor to unleash potent attacks and generate a formidable defense. Armorers view their armor as an extension of their very selves. Inventor and armor become one, as they refine its magical capabilities.

When you adopt the armorer specialty at 1st-level, you gain proficiency with smith’s tools and heavy armor. If you are already proficient with smith’s tools, you gain proficiency with another set of artisan’s tools of your choice.

At 1st-level you have learned to weave arcane magic to forge the signature arcane armor of an Armorer. At the end of a long rest, you can touch your smith’s tools to a set of armor, turning it into arcane armor. This armor is only usable by you, and while wearing it you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: If the armor normally has a Strength requirement, your arcane armor lacks this requirement for you.
You can use your arcane armor as a spellcasting focus.
Your arcane armor attaches to you and can’t be removed against your will. It expands to cover your entire body, and functionally replaces any missing limbs or body parts.
You can don or doff the armor as an action, and can retract or deploy the helmet as a bonus action.
You can use a bonus action to grant yourself temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).

sheet.description: You grant yourself {{int-mod:min-one}} temporary hit points while wearing your arcane armor.

description.p: Starting at 3rd-level, you arm the gauntlets of your arcane armor for offense. You can use your Intelligence modifier, in place of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls of your weaponized gauntlets. Choose one of the following weaponized gauntlet options:

Lightning Launcher. Your gauntlets count as simple ranged weapons, with a normal range of 90 feet and a long range of 300 feet, and they deal 1d6 lightning damage on hit. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with it, you can deal an additional 1d6 lightning damage.

Thunder Gauntlets. Your gauntlets count as simple melee weapons, and they deals 1d8 thunder damage on hit. When you hit a creature they have disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you until the start of your next turn.
At the end of a long rest, you can use your smith’s tools to change the type of weaponized gauntlets for your armor.

sheet.description: You can use your Intelligence modifier, in place of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls of your weaponized gauntlets. At the end of a long rest, you can use your smith’s tools to change the type of weaponized gauntlets for your armor. Lightning Launcher: simple ranged 90/300: +{{gauntlets:ranged-bonus}} to hit, {{weaponized-gauntlet:damage-dice}}d6 + {{gauntlets:ranged-bonus:ability}} lightning damage. Thunder Gauntlets: simple melee: +{{gauntlets:melee-bonus}} to hit, {{weaponized-gauntlet:damage-dice}}d8 + {{gauntlets:melee-bonus:ability}} thunder damage.

description.p: Starting at 5th level, you can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: You have learned to incorporate your artifice with magical items. Beginning at 5th-level, you can touch a magical suit of armor and use it as your arcane armor. Bonuses to your Armor Class, or any other features, do not stack. You must choose one instance of the bonus or feature to use.

sheet.description: You can touch a magical suit of armor and use it as your arcane armor.

description.p: Beginning at 9th-level, your arcane armor now counts as separate items for the purposes of your infusions: armor (the chest piece), boots, helmet, and the gauntlets (weapon). Each of those items can bear one of your infusions. Your number of Infusions Known increases by 2, but those extra infusions must be applied to part of your arcane armor.

sheet.description: Your arcane armor now counts as separate items for the purposes of your infusions: armor (the chest piece), boots, helmet, and the gauntlets (weapon). Each of those items can bear one of your infusions. Your number of Infusions Known increases by 2, but those extra infusions must be applied to part of your arcane armor.

description.p: You have become an master armorer artificer. Upon reaching 15th-level, you have made significant upgrades to your arcane armor improving its combat capability. You gain the following benefits while wearing your arcane armor:

ul.li: Your movement speed increases by 10 feet.
You gain a flying speed equal to your movement speed.
You adjust your weaponized gauntlets so that you have access to both gauntlet options at once.
The damage of your Lightning Launcher becomes 2d6, and the damage of your Thunder Gauntlets becomes 2d8.

sheet.description: You gain the following benefits while wearing your arcane armor: Your movement speed and fly speed is {{master-armorer:speed}}. You adjust your weaponized gauntlets so that you have access to both gauntlet options at once.

description.p: Armies require protection, and someone has to put things back together if defenses fail. A combination of protector and medic, a battle smith is an expert at defending others and repairing both material and personnel. To aid in their work, battle smiths are usually accompanied by a steel defender, a protective companion of their own creation.

td.em: circle of power, mass cure wounds

description.p: When you adopt the battle smith specialty at 1st-level, you gain proficiency with smith’s tools and heavy armor. If you are already proficient with smith’s tools, you gain proficiency with another set of artisan’s tools of your choice.
Starting at 1st-level, you can use your Intelligence, in place of Strength or Dexterity, for your attack and damage rolls with magic weapons, or a weapon bearing one of your infusions.

In addition, when a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. You must be wielding a shield to use this reaction.

sheet.description: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. You must be wielding a shield. You can use your Intelligence, in place of Strength or Dexterity, for your attack and damage rolls with magic weapons, or a weapon bearing one of your infusions.

description.p: By 3rd-level, your tinkering has borne you a faithful construct, a steel defender. It is friendly to you and your companions, and it obeys your commands. See this creature’s game statistics in the Steel Defender stat block, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in multiple places.

In combat, your steel defender shares your initiative count, but takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on it’s own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the Dodge action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take the action in its stat block or the Dash, Disengage, Help, Hide or Search action. If you are incapacitated, the steel defender takes an action of its choice.

If the steel defender has died within the last hour, as an action, you can touch it with your smith’s tools and expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher to revive it. The steel defender returns to life with its maximum hit points.
When you finish a long rest, you can create a new steel defender with your smith’s tools. If you already have a steel defender from this feature, the first one perishes.
Upon creation, choose the shape of your steel defender from the options below. Its shape determines its abilities.

Humanoid. Your steel defender resembles a medium humanoid creature of your choice, but is clearly a construct. It has opposable fingers and is proficient with shields. It can use its digits to perform basic tasks, and it can equip or wear any items that are appropriate for its anatomy.

Quadruped. Your steel defender resembles large beast of your choice, but is clearly a construct. Its movement speed increases by 10 feet, and it is trained to be ridden as a mount, but only by you. When being used as a mount, the steel defender retains its place in initiative order, but can use its movement speed as part of your turn.

sheet.description: When you finish a long rest, you can create a new steel defender with your smith’s tools.

description.p: Beginning at 5th-level, your steel defender gains one of the following offensive upgrades. At the end of a long rest, you can touch your steel defender with your smith’s tools and select another option from this feature.

Minor Arcane Core. Your steel defender is imbued with a 1st-level artificer spell (your choice). As a bonus action, you can command your steel defender to cast the imbued spell at 1st-level, using your Intelligence as the spellcasting modifier.
It can cast this spell a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and it regains all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Martial Offense. The damage of your steel defender’s Rend becomes 1d10, and when you command it to take the Rend action it can makes two Rend attacks instead of one. The steel defender can replace either Rend attack with a grapple or shove attack if you command it to.

sheet.description: Your steel defender has one of the following offensive upgrades. At the end of a long rest, you can touch your steel defender with your smith’s tools and select another option from this feature. Minor Arcane Core: Your steel defender is imbued with a 1st-level artificer spell (your choice). As a bonus action, you can command your steel defender to cast the imbued spell at 1st-level, using your Intelligence as the spellcasting modifier (up to {{int-mod:min-one}}/Long Rest). Martial Offense: The damage of your steel defender’s Rend becomes 1d10, and when you command it to take the Rend action it can makes two Rend attacks instead of one. The steel defender can replace either Rend attack with a grapple or shove attack if you command it to.

description.p: Starting at 9th-level, you choose one of the following improved upgrades for your steel defender. At the end of a long rest, you can touch your steel defender with your smith’s tools and select another option from this feature.

Limited Sentience. You improve the cognitive abilities of your steel defender. It’s Intelligence score becomes a 10, it gains proficiency in Arcana, History, or Investigation, or with a set of artisan’s tools of your choice. It also learns to speak, read, and write one language you know.
Reinforced Plating. You improve the structure of your steel defender. It is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks.

Restorative Touch. You imbue your steel defender with a pool of healing magic. The pool has a number of points equal to four times your artificer level. As a bonus action, you can command your steel defender to touch a creature and draw power from the pool to restore a number of hit points to that creature, up to the maximum amount remaining in its pool.

sheet.description: At the end of a long rest, you can touch your steel defender with your smith’s tools and select another option from this feature: Limited Sentience, Reinforced Plating, or Restorative Touch. Rein

description.p: You have become an master among battle smith artificers. Beginning at 15th-level, you choose one of the following masterwork upgrades for your steel defender. At the end of a long rest, you can touch your steel defender with your smith’s tools and select another option from this feature.
Arcane Defensive Field. Your steel defender emits an arcane ward. Creatures within 15 feet of your steel defender are resistant to damage from spells and magical effects.

Self Destruct. You embed a powerful explosive within your steel defender. As a bonus action, you can command your steel defender to self destruct, and force every creature within 20 feet of it to make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 10d6 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. Once your steel defender uses this ability it cannot be revived until the end of your next long rest.

Greater Arcane Core. Your steel defender is imbued with a 3rd-level artificer spell (your choice). As a bonus action, you can command your steel defender to cast the imbued spell at 3rd-level, using your Intelligence as the spellcasting modifier.
It can cast this spell a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and it regains all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: At the end of a long rest, you can touch your steel defender with your smith’s tools and select another option from this feature: Arcane Defensive Field, Self Destruct, or Greater Arcane Core.

description.p: Every wandslinger desires to become a master offensive arcane magic. This desire is what fuels a wandslinger to craft their signature sidearm. This weapon can take many shapes depending on the wandslinger and the level of technology they have access to. The earliest wandslingers channeled magic power through meticulously carved wooden wands.

Wandslingers of all cultures and means create unique sidearms, ranging from wooden staffs to iron cannons. Whatever their method, a wandslinger’s ability to hurl magic makes them powerful allies and terrifying foes.

td.em: cone of cold, wall of force

description.p: When you adopt the artillerist specialty at 1st-level, you gain proficiency with woodcarver’s tools. If you are already proficient with woodcarver’s tools, you gain proficiency with another set of artisan’s tools of your choice.

At 1st-level, you craft the trademark weapon of a wandslinger, your signature sidearm. At the end of a long rest, you can use your woodcarver’s tools to craft a sidearm, which appears as a Tiny object of your choice. When you gain the Spellcasting feature at 2nd-level, your sidearm can be used as a spellcasting focus for your artificer spells.

While wielding your signature sidearm, you can use your action to make a spell attack against a creature you can see within 120 feet. On hit, the target takes force damage equal to 1d10 + your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).
You can only have one sidearm at a time, creating a second sidearm immediately causes the first one to become inert.

sheet.description: At the end of a long rest, you can use your woodcarver’s tools to craft a sidearm, which appears as a Tiny object of your choice. You can use it as a spellcasting focus. While wielding your signature sidearm, you can use your action to make a spell attack against a creature you can see within 120 feet. On hit, the target takes 1d10 + {{int-mod:min-one}} force damage.

description.p: Starting at 3rd-level, you learn to enhance your signature sidearm with eldritch runes. At the end of each long rest, you inscribe your sidearm with one of the eldritch runes below. As a bonus action on your turn, while you are wielding your sidearm, you can produce the effect of the rune.

Blast. Your sidearm emits a blast of thunderous magic in an adjacent 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, creatures take 2d6 thunder damage and are knocked back 5 feet.

Explosion. You produce a burst of arcane lightning at a point you can see within 60 feet. Each creature within 5 feet must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d6 lightning damage on a failed save, and half as much on a success.

Protection. You emit a wave of positive energy from your sidearm that grants you, and each creature of your choice within 10 feet, a number of temporary hit points equal to 1d6 + your Intelligence modifier (minimum of+ 1).

sheet.description: At the end of each long rest, you inscribe your sidearm with one of these eldritch runes: Blast: 15-foot cone, Dex save or {{eldritch-rune:damage-dice}}d6 thunder damage. Explosion: point you can see, 60 feet. Creatures within 5 feet, Dex save or {{eldritch-rune:damage-dice}}d6 lightning damage (half on success). Protection: each creature of your choice within 10 feet, gain {{eldritch-rune:healing-dice}}d6 + {{int-mod:min-one}} temporary hit points. As a bonus action on your turn, while you are wielding your sidearm, you can produce the effect of the rune.

description.p: Starting at 5th-level, when you use your action to make an attack with your signature sidearm you can make two spell attacks, instead of one. Each spell attack can target the same or separate creatures, and you make a separate attack roll for each spell attack. This increases to three spell attacks when you reach 11th-level, and to four when you reach 17th-level.

sheet.description: When you use your action to make an attack with your signature sidearm you can make two spell attacks.
When you use your action to make an attack with your signature sidearm you can make three spell attacks.
When you use your action to make an attack with your signature sidearm you can make four spell attacks.

description.p: Starting at 9th-level, the eldritch runes that you inscribe into your signature sidearm have grown more powerful. The rolls of all three of your eldritch runes increase by 1d6.
In addition, you can change the eldritch rune you have inscribed in your sidearm at the end of a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You can change the eldritch rune you have inscribed in your sidearm at the end of a short or long rest.

description.p: You have become a master wandslinger. Starting at 15th-level, you improve your signature sidearm in the following ways:

ul.li: When you use your action to cast a spell, you can attack with your signature sidearm as a bonus action.
Your sidearm is inscribed with all three eldritch runes. However, you can only activate one rune per bonus action.
Once per short or long rest when you cast a spell using your sidearm as your spellcasting focus, you can change all damage dealt by the spell to force damage.

sheet.description: When you use your action to cast a spell, you can attack with your signature sidearm as a bonus action. Your sidearm is inscribed with all three eldritch runes. However, you can only activate one rune per bonus action. Once per short or long rest when you cast a spell using your sidearm as your spellcasting focus, you can change all damage dealt by the spell to force damage.

description.p: Item: A rod or wand

This tiny length of wood is infused with a cantrip from the wizard spell list (your choice upon infusion). The user can use their action to produce the cantrip from the object, using your Intelligence as the spellcasting ability. At 9th-level you can imbue this item with two wizard cantrips of your choice, and three cantrips at 17th-level.

sheet.description: This tiny length of wood is infused with a cantrip from the wizard spell list (your choice upon infusion).
This tiny length of wood is infused with a cantrip from the wizard spell list (your choice upon infusion).
This tiny length of wood is infused with a cantrip from the wizard spell list (your choice upon infusion).

description.p: Item: A glove or gauntlet

This tiny magical launcher can be loaded with a Tiny object, including but not limited to; ball bearings, a vial of acid, or holy water. As a bonus action the wearer can activate the launcher and make a ranged attack at a target up to 20 feet away. The launcher can be reloaded as an action.

sheet.description: This tiny magical launcher can be loaded with a Tiny object, including but not limited to; ball bearings, a vial of acid, or holy water. As a bonus action the wearer can activate the launcher and make a ranged attack at a target up to 20 feet away. The launcher can be reloaded as an action.

description.p: Item: A rod, staff, or wand (requires attunement)
This item grants the user +1 bonus to spell attack rolls, and they can ignore half cover when making a spell attack. The bonus increases to +2 at 9th-level and +3 at 15th-level.

sheet.description: +{{bonus-only-item:bonus}} bonus to spell attack rolls, and they can ignore half cover when making a spell attack.

description.p: Item: A suit of armor or a shield
This item grants the user +1 bonus to their armor class while wearing (armor) or wielding (shield) the infused item. The bonus increases to +2 at 9th-level and +3 at 15th-level.

sheet.description: +{{bonus-only-item:bonus}} bonus to their armor class while wearing (armor) or wielding (shield) the infused item.

description.p: Item: A simple or martial weapon
This magic weapon grants the user a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. The bonus increases to +2 at 9th-level and +3 at 15th-level.

sheet.description: +{{bonus-only-item:bonus}} bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the infused weapon.

description.p: Item: A belt or cloak (requires attunement)
When worn, this magic belt reduces the user to one-tenth of their normal weight. Starting at 9th-level it reduces the wearer to one-hundredth of their normal weight.

sheet.description: When worn, this magic belt reduces the user to one-tenth of their normal weight.
When worn, this magic belt reduces the user to one-hundredth of their normal weight.

description.p: Item: A heavy or two-handed weapon (requries attunement)

This magic weapon no longer has either the heavy or two-handed property (your choice upon infusion). At 9th-level this magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls, and the bonus increases to +2 at 15th-level.

sheet.description: This magic weapon no longer has either the heavy or two-handed property (your choice upon infusion).
This magic weapon no longer has either the heavy or two-handed property (your choice upon infusion). +{{feature-item:bonus}} to attack and damage rolls.

description.p: Item: A pair of goggles or glasses

While wearing these goggles, the wearer can see through lightly obscured areas without disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks. In addition, the wearer no longer suffers the negative effects from the Sunlight Sensativity trait.

sheet.description: While wearing these goggles, the wearer can see through lightly obscured areas without disadvantage on Perception checks. In addition, the wearer no longer suffers the negative effects from the Sunlight Sensativity trait.

description.p: Item: A whip or chain
This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and it’s damage die increases to 1d8. This bonus increases to +2 at 9th-level and +3 at 15th-level.

sheet.description: +{{bonus-only-item:bonus}} bonus to attack and damage rolls with this infused whip or chain.

description.p: Item: A ranged weapon (requires attunement)

This magic weapon ignores the loading property if it has it. If you load no ammunition into the weapon it produces its own, creating one piece of magical ammunition when you make a ranged attack with it. This magical ammunition vanishes the instant after it hits or misses the target.
At 9th-level this magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls, and the bonus increases to +2 at 15th-level.

sheet.description: This magic weapon ignores the loading property if it has it. If you load no ammunition into the weapon it produces its own, creating one piece of magical ammunition when you make a ranged attack with it.

This magic weapon ignores the loading property if it has it. If you load no ammunition into the weapon it produces its own, creating one piece of magical ammunition when you make a ranged attack with it. +{{feature-item:bonus}} bonus to attach and damage rolls made with this infused weapon.

description.p: Using this infusion, you can replicate any common magic item.

sheet.description: Using this infusion, you can replicate any common magic item.

element.name: Replicate Minor Magic Item: Alchemy Jug

description.p: Using this infusion, you can replicate an Alchemy Jug.

sheet.description: Using this infusion, you can replicate an Alchemy Jug.

description.p: Using this infusion, you can replicate a Bag of Holding.

sheet.description: Using this infusion, you can replicate a Bag of Holding.

description.p: Using this infusion, you can replicate a Cap of Water Breathing.

sheet.description: Using this infusion, you can replicate a Cap of Water Breathing.

description.p: Using this infusion, you can replicate Goggles of Night.

sheet.description: Using this infusion, you can replicate Goggles of Night.

element.name: Replicate Minor Magic Item: Prosthetic Limb

description.p: Using this infusion, you can replicate a Prosthetic Limb. The Prosthetic Limb requires attunement.

sheet.description: Using this infusion, you can replicate a Prosthetic Limb. The Prosthetic Limb requires attunement.

element.name: Replicate Minor Magic Item: Rope of Climbing

description.p: Using this infusion, you can replicate a Rope of Climbing.

sheet.description: Using this infusion, you can replicate a Rope of Climbing.

element.name: Replicate Minor Magic Item: Sending Stones

description.p: Using this infusion, you can replicate Sending Stones.

sheet.description: Using this infusion, you can replicate Sending Stones.

element.name: Replicate Minor Magic Item: Wand of Magic Detection

description.p: Using this infusion, you can replicate a Wand of Magic Detection.

sheet.description: Using this infusion, you can replicate a Wand of Magic Detection.

element.name: Replicate Minor Magic Item: Wand of Secrets

description.p: Using this infusion, you can replicate a Wand of Secrets.

sheet.description: Using this infusion, you can replicate a Wand of Secrets.

description.p: Item: A weapon with the thrown property
After making a ranged attack this magic weapon, whether you hit or miss, it immediately returns to the wielders hand.
At 9th-level this magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls, and the bonus increases to +2 at 15th-level.

sheet.description: After making a ranged attack this magic weapon, whether you hit or miss, it immediately returns to the wielders hand.
After making a ranged attack this magic weapon, whether you hit or miss, it immediately returns to the wielders hand. +{{feature-item:bonus}} bonus to attack and damage rolls with the weapon.

description.p: Prerequisite: 5th-level artificer
Item: A ranged or thrown weapon
The wielder of this magic weapon ignores the disadvantage imposed when attacking at the weapon’s long range.
At 9th-level this magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls, and the bonus increases to +2 at 15th-level.

sheet.description: The wielder of this magic weapon ignores the disadvantage imposed when attacking at the weapon’s long range.
The wielder of this magic weapon ignores the disadvantage imposed when attacking at the weapon’s long range. +{{feature-item:bonus}} bonus to attack and damage rolls with this weapon.

description.p: Prerequisite: 5th-level artificer
Item: A pair of boots (requires attunement)

When the user is standing on a flat surface, they can use an action to activate the boots, magically fixing the user in place. Until you use an action to deactivate the boots, you do not move, even if you are defying gravity.
A creature can use an action to make a DC 30 Strength check, separating your boots from the surface on a success.

sheet.description: When the user is standing on a flat surface, they can use an action to activate the boots, magically fixing the user in place. Until you use an action to deactivate the boots, you do not move, even if you are defying gravity. A creature can use an action to make a DC 30 Strength check, separating your boots from the surface on a success.

description.p: Prerequisite: 5th-level artificer
Item: A suit of armor (requires attunement)

This magic suit of armor retains its weight, but is formfitting, wearable under clothing, and is virtually weightless. While wearing this magical armor, the wearer has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.
If the armor normally imposes disadvantage on such checks, the advantage and disadvantage cancel each other.

sheet.description: This magic suit of armor retains its weight, but is formfitting, wearable under clothing, and is virtually weightless. While wearing this magical armor, the wearer has advantage on Stealth checks.

description.p: Prerequisite: 5th-level artificer
Item: A sword hilt or wand (requires attunement)

While grasping the item, the wielder can use a bonus action to cause a blade of pure radiance to spring into existence, or dissapear, from the end of the item. While the blade exists, this magic item is a simple weapon with the finesse property. The luminous blade emits bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. The light is sunlight.

The wielder gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals 1d8 radiant damage on hit. If the target is undead, it takes an additional 1d8 radiant damage. The bonus increases to +2 at 15th-level.

sheet.description: While grasping the item, the wielder can use a bonus action to cause a blade of pure radiance to spring into existence, or dissapear, from the end of the item. +{{light-blade:bonus}} bonus to attack and damage rolls (1d8, 2d8 if target is undead.

description.p: Prerequisite: 5th-level artificer
Item: A melee weapon (requires attunement)
As a bonus action, the wielder can cause this weapon to emit bright light in a 30-foot radius, and dim light 30 feet beyond that. The wielder can extinguish the light as a bonus action.

The weapon has 4 charges. When the wielder hits a creature with a melee attack, they can expend 1 charge and force the target to make a Constitution saving throw against your artificer spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature is blinded until the start of your next turn. The weapon regains all expended charges at dawn.
At 9th-level this magic weapon grants a +1 to attack and damage rolls, and the bonus increases to +2 at 15th-level.

sheet.description: As a bonus action, the wielder can cause this weapon to emit bright light in a 30-foot radius, and dim light 30 feet beyond that. The wielder can extinguish the light as a bonus action. The weapon has 4 charges. When the wielder hits a creature with a melee attack, they can expend 1 charge and force the target to make a Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the start of your next turn.

As a bonus action, the wielder can cause this weapon to emit bright light in a 30-foot radius, and dim light 30 feet beyond that. The wielder can extinguish the light as a bonus action. The weapon has 4 charges. When the wielder hits a creature with a melee attack, they can expend 1 charge and force the target to make a Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the start of your next turn. +{{feature-item:bonus}} to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

description.p: Prerequisite: 5th-level artificer
Using this infusion, you can replicate Boots of Elvenkind.

Using this infusion, you can replicate a Lantern of Revealing.

description.p: Prerequisite: 5th-level artificer
Using this infusion, you can replicate a Ring of Jumping.

sheet.description: Using this infusion, you can replicate a Ring of Jumping.

element.name: Replicate Greater Magic Item: Slippers of Spider Climbing

description.p: Prerequisite: 5th-level artificer
Using this infusion, you can replicate Slippers of Spider Climbing.

sheet.description: Using this infusion, you can replicate Slippers of Spider Climbing.

description.p: Prerequisite: 5th-level artificer
Item: A pair of gloves or gauntlets (requires attunement)

These magical gauntlets have 4 charges. When the wearer hits a creature with an unarmed strike they can expend 1 charge and force the target to make a Strength saving throw against your artificer spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature is knocked back 15 feet. The gauntlets regain all expended charges at dawn.
At 9th-level these magic gauntlets grant a +1 to attack and damage rolls, and the bonus increases to +2 at 15th-level.

sheet.description: Gauntlets have 4 charges. When the wearer hits a creature with an unarmed strike they can expend 1 charge and force the target to make a Strength saving throw or be knocked back 15 feet.

Gauntlets have 4 charges. When the wearer hits a creature with an unarmed strike they can expend 1 charge and force the target to make a Strength saving throw or be knocked back 15 feet. +{{feature-item:bonus}} bonus on attack and damage rolls.

description.p: Prerequisite: 5th-level artificer
Item: A shield (requires attunement)

This magic shield has 4 charges. After being hit with a melee attack, the wielder can use their reaction to expend 1 charge and force the attacker to make a Strength saving throw against your artificer spell save DC. On a failed save, the attacker is knocked back 15 feet. The shield regains all expended charges at dawn.
At 9th-level this magic shield grants you a +1 bonus to your armor class, and the bonus increases to +2 at 15th-level.

sheet.description: Magic shield has 4 charges. After being hit with a melee attack, the wielder can use their reaction to expend 1 charge and force the attacker to make a Strength saving throw or knocked back 15 feet.

Magic shield has 4 charges. After being hit with a melee attack, the wielder can use their reaction to expend 1 charge and force the attacker to make a Strength saving throw or knocked back 15 feet. +{{feature-item:bonus}} bonus to AC.

description.p: Prerequisite: 5th-level artificer
Item: A ring
The wearer of this ring gains proficiency with one skill, tool, or weapon, or learn one language (your choice upon infusion).

sheet.description: The wearer of this ring gains proficiency with one skill, tool, or weapon, or learn one language (your choice upon infusion).

description.p: Prerequisite: 5th-level artificer
Item: An armored gauntlet and a martial weapon or shield

You attach either a martial weapon lacking the heavy or two handed properties, or a shield to the gauntlet. The wearer gains proficiency with the attached item, and it cannot be removed from the gauntlet while this infusion is active.

sheet.description: You attach either a martial weapon lacking the heavy or two handed properties, or a shield to the gauntlet. The wearer gains proficiency with the attached item, and it cannot be removed from the gauntlet while this infusion is active.

description.p: Prerequisite: 9th-level artificer
Item: a suit of armor (requires attunement)
The wearer of this magical armor can use their Intelligence, in place of Strength, for Strength checks and saving throws.

In addition, this armor has 4 charges. As a reaction when the wearer would be knocked prone or moved against their will, they can expend 1 charge to remain standing or not move. The armor regains all charges at the end of a long rest.

sheet.description: The wearer of this magical armor can use their Intelligence, in place of Strength, for Strength checks and saving throws. This armor has 4 charges. As a reaction when the wearer would be knocked prone or moved against their will, they can expend 1 charge to remain standing or not move.

description.p: Prerequisite: 9th-level artificer
Item: A pair of boots (requires attunement)
The wearer of these magical boots can use a bonus action to teleport up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space they can see.

sheet.description: The wearer of these magical boots can use a bonus action to teleport up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space they can see.

description.p: Prerequisite: 9th-level artificer
Item: a suit of armor (requires attunement)

This armor has 4 charges. While wearing this magical armor the wearer can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following Spells: invisibility (2 charges) or greater invisibility (4 charges). The armor regains all expended charges at dawn.

sheet.description: This armor has 4 charges. While wearing this magical armor the wearer can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following Spells: invisibility (2 charges) or greater invisibility (4 charges).

description.p: Prerequisite: 9th-level artificer
Item: A melee weapon (requires attunement)

You infuse a weapon with elemental energy. Upon infusion choose a command word and one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, poison, or lightning. As a bonus action, the wielder can speak the command word and cause elemental energy to burst forth from the weapon until the command word is spoken again. On hit, the weapon deals an additional 1d4 of the elemental damage. The additional damage from this infusion increases to 1d6 at 15th-level.

sheet.description: Upon infusion choose a command word and one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, poison, or lightning. As a bonus action, the wielder can speak the command word and cause elemental energy to burst forth from the weapon until the command word is spoken again. On hit, the weapon deals an additional 1d{{elemental-weapon:die-type}} of the elemental damage.

description.p: Prerequisite: 9th-level artificer
Item: A suit of armor (requires attunement)

While wearing this armor, a creature has resistance to one of the following damage types, which you choose when you infuse the item: acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, or thunder.

sheet.description: While wearing this armor, a creature has resistance to one of the following damage types, which you choose when you infuse the item: acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, or thunder.

description.p: Prerequisite: 9th-level artificer
Using this infusion, you can replicate any uncommon magic item that does not require attunement.

sheet.description: Using this infusion, you can replicate any uncommon magic item that does not require attunement.

description.p: Prerequisite: 9th-level artificer
Item: A ring (requires attunement)
Upon infusing this magic ring you select one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, poison, lightning, or thunder.
When the wearer casts a spell that deals the damage type that you selected, they can activate this ring to deal maximum damage to one target of the spell instead of rolling.
Once this ring is activated it cannot be used again until the wearer completes a short or long rest.

sheet.description: Upon infusing this magic ring you select one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, poison, lightning, or thunder. When the wearer casts a spell that deals the damage type that you selected, they can activate this ring to deal maximum damage to one target of the spell instead of rolling.

description.p: Prerequisite: 15th-level artificer
Item: A pair of gauntlets (requires attunement)

These magic gauntlets are infused with an arcane pulling force. When the wielder has a free hand, and a Huge or smaller creature ends its turn within 30 feet, they can use their reaction and force it to make a Strength saving throw against your artificer spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature is pulled 30 feet toward them, to an unoccupied space of their choice. If they pull the target within 5 feet of them, they can make one weapon attack against the creature.

sheet.description: When the wielder has a free hand, and a Huge or smaller creature ends its turn within 30 feet, they can use their reaction and force it to make a Strength saving throw or be pulled 30 feet toward them, to an unoccupied space of their choice. If they pull the target within 5 feet of them, they can make one weapon attack against the creature.

description.p: Prerequisite: 15th-level artificer
Item: A helm, hat, or diadem (requires attunement)

The wearer of this magic helm is resistant to psychic damage, immune to the charmed and frightened conditions, and any magic that allows another creature to read their thoughts or telepathically communicate with them.

sheet.description: The wearer of this magic helm is resistant to psychic damage, immune to the charmed and frightened conditions, and any magic that allows another creature to read their thoughts or telepathically communicate with them.

description.p: Prerequisite: 15th-level artificer

You have discovered the secrets to the creation of life. You learn the clone spell. It counts as an artificer spell for you, but it doesn’t count against your number of Spells Known. You can cast clone without expending a spell slot as long as you have the material components available.
If you replace this infusion with another at any point during the incubation period, the spell immediately fails.

sheet.description: You can cast clone without expending a spell slot as long as you have the material components available. If you replace this infusion with another at any point during the incubation period, the spell immediately fails.

setters.set: Hit Points 1 + two times your artificer level. (the homunculus has a number of hit dice [d4s] equal to your artificer level)
Perception + proficiency bonus, Stealth +2 + proficiency bonus

description.p: If the homunculus makes a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.
When the homunculus is within 120 feet of you, it can deliver a spell that you cast that have a range of touch.
Ranged Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit, range 30 ft., one target you can see. Hit: 1d4 + PB force damage.
The homunculus can administer an Elixir they are carrying to a creature within 5 feet.

setters.set: 5 + five times your artificer level (the steel defender has a number of hit dice [d10s] equal to your artificer level)

description.p: You add your PB to any ability check, attack roll, or saving throw that the steel defender makes.
The defender can’t be surprised.
Melee Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target you can see. Hit: 1d8 + PB force damage.
The steel defender can expend one of its Hit Dice to restore 1d10 +PB hit points to itself or to one construct or object within 5 feet of it.
